definition: hear the wind and lose gall (idiom); terror-stricken at the news
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.english: Nuclear radiation, invisible and insidious, gives us the creeps.
sentences.chinese: 核輻射的無形性和潛伏性令人類聞風喪膽。

sentences.english: That is enough to keep away from the tiger (India).
sentences.chinese: 這一點就足夠讓它們聞風喪膽，遠離印度這隻老虎。
